sentence.Network_en: Without warning, Bardo smacked his fist into his open hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 巴多没有任何预兆地一拳砸在自己摊开的手掌上.

sentence.Network_en: The driver managed to escape from the vehicle and shout a warning.
sentence.Network_cn: 那名司机设法从车里逃了出来并大声警告别人。

sentence.Network_en: I had this uncanny feeling that Alice was warning me.
sentence.Network_cn: 我有一种奇怪的感觉：艾丽斯是在警告我。

entry.def: A warning is something which is said or written to tell people of a possible danger, problem, or other unpleasant thing that might happen.

example.ex: The minister gave a warning that if war broke out, it would be catastrophic...
example.tran: 部长警告说，战争一旦爆发将会是灾难性的。

example.ex: He was killed because he ignored a warning to put stronger cords on his parachute...
example.tran: 他忽视了降落伞上要求使用更结实的绳索的警告信息，因而命丧黄泉。

entry.def: A warning is an advance notice of something that will happen, often something unpleasant or dangerous.

example.ex: The soldiers opened fire without warning...
example.tran: 士兵们在没有发出警告的情况下开了枪。

example.ex: With no warning, he was fired from his job...
example.tran: 他没有受到任何警告，就被解雇了。

entry.def: Warning actions or signs give a warning.

example.tran: 她忽视了一些预警信号。

example.ex: Some fog warning signs had been put up with flashing yellow lights.
example.tran: 一些配有黄色闪光灯的大雾警示标志立了起来。

means.word_mean: 2. cautionary advice about something imminent (especially imminent danger)

auth_sentence.content: There had been no warning, and no consultation.
auth_sentence.res_content: There had been no warning, and no consultation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There had been no warning, and no consultation.

Sentence.sentence: The other measures include restricting portion sizes, taxing and prohibiting special price deals for junk foods, and placing warning labels on the products.
Just when you had figured out how to manage fat in your diet, researchers are now warning against another common mealtime pitfall (陷阱) — salt
Contrary to the old warning that time waits for no one, time slows down when you are on the move.
That's both an opportunity and a warning for the best higher-education system in the world.
The most important warning is this: if you have severe symptoms and they don't go away, go down!
The author's second warning is that we should avoid running a greater risk by challenging our boss's anthority.

sentences.en: He gave us a warning against placing confidence in people we did not know.
sentences.cn: 他告诫我们, 不要轻信我们不了解的人。

means.word_mean: 警告的;告诫的;引为戒的

sentences.en: The policeman fired a warning shot.
